question:
Consider the following Indus Valley sites with rivers on the banks of which they were situated:
  1. Mohenjodaro - Indus
  2. Ropar - Sutlej
  3. Banawali - Ghaggar
  4. Harappa - Ravi
   Which of the above are correct?
explanation: Mohenjo-Daro is an archaeological site in the Sindh province of Pakistan located on the banks of river Indus. Ropar is located in Punjab on the banks of the river Sutlej. Banawali is an archaeological site belonging to Indus Valley Civilization period located in Haryana. It was situated on the banks of river Ghaggar which now dried up.
